sentences.en: A sense that something is about to occur; a premonition.
sentences.cn: 我能感觉到,在那个时候, 他的一生发生了变化.

sentences.en: All this gave Ming - feng a frightening premonition of what her own destiny would be.
sentences.cn: 这一切不过是给鸣凤预报她自己的归宿罢了.

sentences.en: As we approached the house, I had a premonition that something terrible had happened.
sentences.cn: 我们走近这所房子时, 我预感到出事了.

sentences.en: Everything seemed clear to him now; he had a premonition of a still unhappier future.
sentences.cn: 他似乎明白了这一切, 而且将来的更不愉快的结果也预言似地出现在他的眼前了.

sentences.en: He had an unshakable premonition that he would die.
sentences.cn: 他有一种强烈的预感，觉得自己会死。

sentences.en: He had had a premonition about this a long time ago.
sentences.cn: 他早就看出了这件事的苗头.

sentences.en: I bet £10 on a horse called Premonition.
sentences.cn: 我在一匹名叫“预兆”的赛马上下了10英镑的赌注。

sentences.en: I have a premonition that there will be a storm.
sentences.cn: 我有暴风雨要来的预感.

sentences.en: I was sure now that my premonition of evil was justified.
sentences.cn: 我敢肯定我对于罪恶的预感是公正的.

sentences.en: In young man heart suddenly crimple , produced a kind bodeful premonition.
sentences.cn: 年轻男子心中猛地缩紧了, 产生了一种不祥预感.

sentences.en: The day before her accident, she had a premonition of danger.
sentences.cn: 在发生事故的前一天, 她有种危险的预感.

sentences.en: The morning before the car accident , he had a premonition of disaster.
The Power Glove gave me a premonition of my own death.
sentences.cn: 如果我告诉你拳神手套令我知道我什么时候会死.

sentences.en: This unpleasant premonition was followed by anxiety.
sentences.cn: 随着这种不愉快的预感便产生了一阵忧虑.

trans.tran_cn: 预感，预兆，前兆，征兆，预先的警告（告诫），预诫
trans.tran_en: a strange feeling that something, especially something bad, is going to happen
